elements.title: Lorens von der Linde (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Swedish general Lorens von der Linde (pictured) once shocked a British diplomat with his stories of King Charles X Gustav's German liaisons?

elements.title: The Failure of Technology (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that scholars have described the 1946 book The Failure of Technology as a precursor to the environmental movement?

elements.title: Ilariu Dobridor (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Romanian far-right journalist Ilariu Dobridor died after being beaten and locked in his own home?

elements.title: Birinci İnönü-class submarines (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Dutch-built and Turkish-operated Birinci İnönü-class submarines were used to discreetly develop German U-boats?

elements.title: Dredge (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Dredge is a Lovecraftian horror and fishing video game?

elements.title: killing of an official by seven women (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the killing of an official by seven women was held up as an example of filial piety?

elements.title: Mariame Clément (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that, when Mariame Clément directed Mozart's Così fan tutte, she froze a wedding tableau during the overture and restarted it in the finale?

elements.title: worst drought (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Turkey is facing its worst drought in the last 50 years?

elements.title: Nobuhiko Jimbo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Nobuhiko Jimbo saved future Philippine president Manuel Roxas from execution during World War II, and Roxas did the same for Jimbo four years later?

elements.title: Destination of the Month (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Destination of the Month

Kowloon

One of the most densely populated cities on Earth, Hong Kong's mainland portion offers a culture less influenced by the British than the neighboring Island, plus accommodation, dining, and nightlife are generally cheaper.

elements.title: Off the Beaten Path (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Off the Beaten Path

El Cuyo

El Cuyo beckons to visitors looking for a quiet, natural seaside town to bask in the sun undisturbed by revelers while other visitors seek adrenaline-pumping excitement.

elements.title: Featured Travel Topic (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Featured Travel Topic

San Diego International Airport

The main airport to America's finest city is the busiest single runway airport in the world.
